name: The Bowery Hotel

reviews.title: The Best of the Real New York
reviews.text: I have been a regular guest at The Bowery since 2008 and can happily say that it is consistently excellent and has remained throughout this time the best place to stay in the lower east-side. The design of the hotel is unique and exudes 1920s style. The rooms are very, very comfortable, well decorated and furnished, and also large for the rates that the hotel charges. The restaurant (Gemma) is also very good, particularly for brunch. Ignore the previous writers who have criticised the hotel regarding its policy on access to the lobby lounge. Once you stay at the hotel you will understand why a strict policy is required for non-hotel guests wandering in--the place would be overrun without it. And for the record, the staff are really nice too.

reviews.title: Home away from home
reviews.text: We love the Bowery Hotel. Above, I wrote "September, 2010" as my date of stay, but I'm not positive that's when I last stayed there. We've slept at the Bowery Hotel about a dozen nights a year for the past several years.

reviews.title: A great hotel experience and location.
reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful in a stylish, tasteful, timeless way. The sheets are great, the assortment of tiny cookies they leave every night are delicious, the rooms are quiet. Some of the bathrooms have really awesome tubs with views of Lower Manhattan, but they all have wonderful showers and great lighting.

reviews.title: In response to the complaints of the Bowery Htoel's lounge policy....
reviews.text: The service here is exactly what we expect from fancy hotels. Every member of the staff has been unfailingly friendly and helpful. Laundry is returned quickly, maid service is incredibly efficient yet invisible, room service is prompt, etc., etc.

reviews.title: Clean and Cozy
reviews.text: We also adore the lounge area. It's true that the cocktails expensive. Of course they are! It's a very popular meeting spot in a 5 star hotel in New York City. Is it actually 5 star? I never pay attention to star numbers. It's certainly a very expensive New York City Hotel, so expect the cost of your cocktails to be representative.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Bowery Hotel for 5 nights in mid-November. Our corner King room (1202) had fantastic views of Lower Manhattan, and I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and the incredibly large and comfy bed. The bathroom was decorated in lovely old school white tile and brass, and the shower was lovely and powerful.
reviews.title: Classy and very cosy

reviews.text: Staff were extremely friendly and willing to help, room service arrived within 20 minutes of ordering, and our meal in the hotel restaurant - Gemma - was fantastic.
reviews.title: My favorite!

reviews.text: The hotel is on a busy main road and 100 yards from a Fire Station, but we were rarely bothered by street noise. In fact the location is perfect, being just 5 minutes walk from 2 main subway lines as well as right in the middle of a neighbourhood full of busy bars, restaurants and independent shops.
reviews.title: Location, location...location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At $500 (plus tax) per night it is not a cheap stay, but for someone looking to spend their time in New York in hip, comfortable luxury, this is the place to come.
reviews.title: Step Back in Time

reviews.text: Rooms are small and old school, but the scene and ambience are the best... Very cool scene in the bar - always good people and celeb watching... The concierge can get you in to any place with little notice .. Great area...
reviews.title: Grace under pressure

reviews.text: It started in the quaint little bar downstairs...fireplace, and a garden out back - it was fun and maybe too much fun, didn't go home. Instead we decided to grab some Zzzz's and breakfast first. :)
reviews.title: Sweet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the 12th floor and had really pretty views as most buildings near that area are not that tall. Rooms are also spacious (for a NY city hotel).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel for someone that is coming to shop and enjoy the dinners and bars.
reviews.title: Miserable Snobby Service

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to everyone going to NYC! We stayed at the Bowery Hotel for part of our honeymoon and it was absolutely lovely. Instead of one of the classic high end hotels we opted for the Bowey as it seemed like a trendier, more happening hotel - and it was. The location was perfect for walking around Soho, Nolita, East village etc, and the lounge downstairs was great. Just the atomsphere we were looking for. We were given a corner room which was lovely and with a great view. When we arrived a complementary bottle of sparkling wine was waiting for us in our room, what a great start! All the staff we encountered were friendly and polite. We ate once a Gemma, which was very good - but I would also like to recommend to those planning to stay here to go to Peels, just next door. We have breakfast here several times and it was excellent (fantastic potato dumplings). All in all, I'm very happy we stayed at the Bowery and we will certainly come back next time we're in New York!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Bowery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another guest and I attempted to take some vacation style photographs today with a little bit of a dressed up flair. I am taking a photography course and came to NYC to get some shots. That doesn't make me, "in the way." I use one normal Canon camera. I didn't have lights or anything obtrusive. Management flipped. Reception was rude. It's kind of ridiculous that you don't have the same rights as some famous celebrity afraid of the paparazzi. I wouldn't stay here again because now I feel super uncomfortable. Don't stay here if you want people to be nice to you and have the same rights as a celebrity. The guest comes first.
reviews.title: A treasure of a hotel

reviews.text: I spent one night at The Bowery at the end of a business trip this past week. While I knew of the hotel from dining at its restaurant Gemma, this was my first time within its wall. I had some hesitation as I don't know the NoHo and NYU neighborhood around it very well, but not an issue. From the moment my cab door was opened, service was top knotch. Every person I encountered ( doorman, bellman, front desk, room service, security ) was professional, polite, pleasant and competent. It was the kind of experience that had me walking out the door the next morning thinking that they ( the employees) were glad to have had me stay there and were appreciative of their roles at the hotel and the services they provide.
reviews.title: Top of the line staff and service

reviews.text: My room was not ready when I arrived, so I went next door to Gemma and read a newspaper at the bar. Within 30 minutes, one of the front desk clerks hand delivered my room key to me. My room was a king deluxe on the 5th floor facing the rear of the hotel. The rooms are just as they appear on the website and I have no complaints. However, while the backyards that the rear rooms face offer a nice explosion of green color to the New York scene, there was a barking dog dominating the soundtrack of the city throughout the early evening.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bowery has a cool and comfortable lobby that rolls into a lounge area, a private patio ( that hotel guests have priority use of in the evening) and the bar. The place has a thriving night scene and if you aren't expecting that in your evening, be aware. I did not use the gym, but understand that it is open 24 hours for use. Exploring the neighborhood and the shops ( soHo stores and galleries are also nearby ) reminded me of my visits to NYC in my 20-something days when there was a more carefree nature to being in town.
reviews.title: Luxury in enviable location

reviews.text: I left very early the next morning and unfortunately did not have breakfast there. But I really enjoyed my brief stay and hope to get back soon. The Bowery is not a cheap stay ( my room was just uner $400 for the night plus the food and drinks), but I cannot praise the staff and their welcoming and professional tone that I wish some other hotels with room rates at that level would consider duplicating. Loved it.
reviews.title: Say hello to Nick, Joshua and...

reviews.text: Stayed at the Bowery after a convention at Times Square - What a great stay - wonderful room, incredible view and the staff was very friendly and helpful!
reviews.title: Service was above and beyond
Outstanding service and 1920's style charm
reviews.text: I enjoyed a delightful stay at The Bowery Hotel with dinner outside the Gemma restaurant. The service was impeccable from the front desk staff, to the wait staff, to the doormen. My room was immaculate and comfortable, with possibly the nicest rainfall shower I've ever seen in a hotel. I normally stay in Hyatt or Westin properties, and was intrigued by the 1920's style charm of The Bowery with the dark wood paneled elevators and intimate lobby seating.

reviews.title: Atmospheric venue in great location
reviews.text: Dinner was excellent and the zucchini flower appetizer is both unusual and delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: This place is definately worth a visit
reviews.text: From before we arrived at the Bowery Hotel staff there had provided us with several recommendations for services in the area for our impending wedding; these all turned out to be first class. Throughout our stay we were treated with courtesy by all staff and nothing was a problem. When we booked the room we asked for a corner room on an upper floor which is exactly what we got. Our room had double full length windows providing great views; it was well equipped, extremely clean and comfortable. The bar and lobby area are very atmospheric and every day of our 5 day trip the place was buzzing. The waiting staff were all characters and very friendly. The restaurant attached to the hotel served very good and reasonably priced Italian food which probably accounted for the fact that it was very busy and again full of atmosphere. Do not be put off in the least by the close proximity of the Bowery Mission because we were treated with respect at all times by the various residents and visitors to that establishment that we came across. The area is well served by bars and restaurants, coffee shops etc and provides easy access on foot to a variety of great parts of town. We will definitely be back

reviews.title: Cool for cocktails and the odd fashion show
reviews.text: Great part of town, staff welcoming and friendly. The bar/lounge is funky and being a guest is a little like being a VIP pushing past the crowds with priority access.

reviews.title: The best hotel of New York City
reviews.text: Bleeker St station is 250 metres away and can zoom you uptown or downtown with trains running every few minutes on the 6.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Bowery hotel over the past weekend and were overwhelmed by the warm hospitality and cofort provided by the team at the hotel. The staff at the desk could not have been more professional and welcoming.... the room very quaint and perfect for the quiet weekend that we desired... the room service arrived almost before we hung up the phone... our questions anticipated prior to request..... Just so refreshing as compared to the "industrial" feel of the large chains or discount properties. Mario in the lounge area creates a "club" like feel where your membership does indeed have privilege! the chance to meet and interact with others or recluse by the fire is wonderful at any time of the year.... the private terrace under glass is also very welcoming... GEMMA next door serves a great breakfast ... the hotel just has it all and is priced very reasonably. i look forward with great anticipation to my next visit to this urban oasis....
reviews.title: the best part of New York City.....

reviews.text: I stayed here last year with my son for 2 nights and we both really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Just sorry that I can't get a room for this trip.

reviews.text: The location is great , very close to Broadway but just far enough away to escape the madness.
reviews.title: Manhattan Classic!
Excellent hotel in favorite neighborhood
reviews.text: I really loved the decor both in the bar and reception area and also in the rooms.
The only problem that I have with this hotel is that I can't get a room for my next visit.
reviews.title: revisiting an old friend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I only stayed one night at The Bowery Hotel, but it was wonderful. First off, you can walk to some great neighborhoods like NoLita, Soho, and the West Village from here. The hotel itself features a gorgeous opulent antique-style decor and has lush touches in the rooms like oriental carpets, marble sinks, plush bathrobes and slippers, and ipod docking surround stereo systems. Our room was a corner room, which was small in size but seemed large enough with the floor-to-ceiling windows exposed (great views of downtown, too). The bed was very comfortable, and the room was quiet despite the active Bowery bar crowd on the street below at night.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, classy, hip, and very New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly, helpful and savvy. Everyone from the front desk to the bellhops recommended bars and restaurants with that hard-to-find mix of hipness without snobbiness. If you feel like staying at the hotel bar, though, you'll find it and the adjoining lounge area a great hangout for you and the trendy LES locals. There are few resources for genuine business travelers, and there's no pool or copy center here, but for the visitor who'd like to stay in a cool luxury hotel without staying in the big midtown chain ones, this is a great choice.
reviews.title: The place to stay when in New York City

reviews.text: I'd recommend this place to everyone visiting New York City. You'll experience the best of lower NYC here, guaranteed.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In one word: the best place to stay when in Nyc (ok, I love the city and I love the Bowery, but the hotel is really a wonderful place)
reviews.title: A fantastic week

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: New York with character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay so there we were my wife and I in the Bowery Hotel on the weekend of Oct 27. The storm had been announced and we tried without success Escape from New York. Monday evening as they were serving our main course in the dining room the power went out. The staff at Gemma (the hotel restaurant) immediately opened Champagne and served it to all the guests with extra candles for the tables.
reviews.title: Any Port in a Storm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From then until Wednesday evening when we were able to checkout - as the power was still not on - the hotel management and staff worked literally around the clock to take care of its guests. from breakfast lunch and dinner buffets without power to cleaning the rooms. The night the power went out , our room key failed to work although the rest of the hotel for the most part was fine. within minutes, the maintenance guys came, un assembled the frame of the door and let us in. then they proceed to re assemble the door. then they fixed the lock - after we were comfortably in our room.
reviews.title: Not sure if I love it or not!

reviews.text: It was the best stay in a bad weather situation. Our thanks goes out to everyone there.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Lower Manhattan

reviews.text: Having stayed in NY before, we wanted to find somewhere in lower Manhatten, as this is where we found ourselves spending most of the time previously, especially in the evening. All the hotels we looked at were very expensive - not sure why but it may have been the week we chose. I see other visitors had rooms with great views etc, but ours was fairly basic but OK. I think for the price I should have asked for a room higher up. The Bowery Hotel is full of character and therein lies the issue. If you are just staying there to sleep and not utilising the bar area, then it is a bit of a waste. I am not sure I would be in the bar in the afternoon as the whole place is occupied by individuals with laptops who are tapping away (unless of course I needed to do that - I can see why people are there as it would be a great place to do this!). The Bowery shuts off the free WiFi at 5pm I think - so that should clear them all out - and then the bar comes into a life of its own. As a resident, they say they will find you somewhere to sit, so it would have been great if we had used it, but as we didn't, I don't think we made the most of the Bowery. Therefore I find it hard to really love the place as the room was OK but very expensive, there was no breakfast and I didn't use the best bit of the hotel - the bar. I think I would stay again provided I could get a good price for the room and I was going to use the bar!
reviews.title: Great skyline view + rich details + happening location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bowery Hotel is very nicely furnished in a faux antique old English kind of style. Since the building is a brand new construction and the furnishings are aging well, things are functioning and are not overly worn, noisy, or otherwise difficult to deal with, such as so many other New York hotels. The rooms have a decent size and nice powerful showers. Downstairs the scene is happening and chilled at once, with some celebrity spotting. My only suggestion would be to spend more time training the staff, especially the receptionists. They seem somewhat unprofessional and uninterested.
reviews.title: Weekend At The Bowery

description: The Bowery Hotel, a delightfully atmospheric luxury hotel in downtown Manhattan has opened its doors on the historic Bowery ushering in a new era of hospitality in one of New York's most exciting and desirable areas. Room types range from standard rooms to one-bedroom terrace suites, all of which boast hardwood floors, floor to ceiling factory windows and sweeping views of NYC.
